inventory.commentary: In many cases with this word, expect more than one sense to apply e.g. 1+2: "I'm going to school, be back later." 2+3: "Our school raised $2 million for a new gymnasium." 14Feb08 update to wn2.1, added features. ahouston 14Feb08 added a sense. ahouston

sense.name: a building which houses educational activities
sense.commentary: SCHOOL[+entity][+physical][+structure][+building][+instructional] Refers to the physical building(s) where instruction takes place
sense.examples: The school door couldn't open due to three feet of snow. The new industrial design school is located at the corner of Walnut and Main. The school caught fire last night and burned to the ground.

sense.name: a social institution whose function is education
sense.examples: The candidate claimed the schools were not doing their job of teaching children to read. The children in these undeveloped parts of the world have never gone to school. The auditions for that ballet school are very difficult. Some of the students will go to trade schools rather than to universities.

sense.name: the students and faculty themselves
sense.commentary: SCHOOL[+entity][+person][+participant][+educational] Refers to the people, the students, teachers, administrators in the institution
sense.examples: The whole school was in the auditorium when the fire alarm went off. The school keeps the parents informed of events and activities. The school is very supportive of their football team.

sense.name: an individual's process of being formally educated
sense.commentary: SCHOOL[+activity][+intellectual][+individual][+learning][+formal] Refers to an individual obtaining a formal education
sense.examples: I have three years of school left. what will you do when you finish school? His father didn't even finish high school. (a level of education) John said he learned nothing useful in school, only in the real world.

sense.name: a distinct artistic or intellectual style, movement
sense.examples: This artist is among the most influential of the Venetian school of painting. He is definitely old school when it comes to management style. (metaphoric extension) Mary had been reading works from the logical positivist school of analytic philosophy.

sense.name: a formation of same-species fish moving together
sense.examples: There were schools of beautiful small fish swimming along the coral reef. The school of minnows darted suddenly to the left.

sense.name: a period of the day for instruction
sense.commentary: SCHOOL[+quantity][+time][+hours][+period][+instructional] Refers to the hours of instruction during a typical day
sense.examples: School starts at 7 am. The children went for ice cream sodas after school yesterday. Mary missed four days of school last week because of illness. School lets out this year on June 7th. (last day of instructional period) There is no school next Monday due to the holiday.
